executive_summary: The movie and video distribution industry primarily circulates audiovisual works to cinemas, TV networks, other exhibitors and stores. As movie theaters around the globe went dark in 2020, studios delayed blockbuster releases or pivoted to online platforms, fundamentally altering distribution dynamics. Although theaters have reopened, the industry is still playing catch-up to pre-pandemic revenue levels, with audiences increasingly favoring the convenience and affordability of streaming services. The industry continues encountering increasing external competition as digital technology enables production studios to distribute their own content and bypass dedicated distributors. The industry has increased its reliance on independent productions and existing content libraries.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue is still chasing the pre-pandemic high
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic adversely affected the global economy in 2020. Industry demand was affected as critical drivers like movie theaters were shut down, pushing back release dates of big box office hits or moving them to streaming services. The movie and video distribution industry inched forward at a CAGR of 0.5% to $2.2 billion over the past five years, including an expected 1.2% incline in 2024. Although profit is expected to slump to 12.1% of revenue in 2024 from 15.3% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital Reshapes Distribution and Impacts Industry Investment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue performance is tied to demand for entertainment, like movies and cable TV, which has been increasingly shifting to video-on-demand (VOD) and streaming services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Content exclusivity has become a critical factor as streaming services compete for subscribers, resulting in substantial investments in original programming.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: High-budget original series and films are increasingly being utilized to drive subscriptions and differentiate platforms from competitors.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Independent Distributors are Leveraging Niche Markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Independent and smaller-scale distributors have found success by focusing on niche audiences that large streaming platforms often overlook.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A DECLINE IN CABLE BROADCASTING DEMAND IS OFFSET BY A RETURN TO THEATERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Cord-cutting trends will continue to siphon demand away from cable broadcasting.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DIGITAL DISTRIBUTION OPPORTUNITIES WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Digital content systems enable users to access content conveniently on multiple devices and will continue to dominate viewer preference.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The industry will continue encountering increasing external competition
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasing external competition from studios will result in continued downward pressure on revenue.

industry_definition: The Movie and Video Distribution industry primarily circulates audiovisual works to cinemas, TV networks, other exhibitors and stores.

positive_impact_factors: High - Decreasing Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: The movie and video distribution industry is highly fragmented and thrives on personal contacts.
Major studios with in-house distribution segments pose an external threat to the industry.
Entering the distribution game is no walk in the park due to high start-up and legal costs.
Streaming services are dominating the entertainment landscape.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The number of fixed broadband connections
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The increasing consumer use of Internet services that reduce revenue for traditional distribution.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Protect rights of creators and owners of original works.
Implement measures to prevent illegal copying and sharing.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Skilled labor continues to be a high and necessary cost.

FAQs.question: How have changes in individual consumer electronic use changed your operations?
FAQs.answer: As use of alternative viewing devices has increased, distributors have experienced less demand from network television and movie theaters.

FAQs.question: How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Digital distribution has lowered costs for film distributors, but also allowed major studios to bypass the industry entirely.
